summary: This is a US Marshals Service prisoner schedule report for the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) dated July 31, 2019. It lists multiple inmates being transported to various court proceedings in Manhattan, detailing their scheduled court times, reasons for transport, and security notes. The document is marked CONFIDENTIAL and for Limited Official Use.

events.title: Brooklyn MDC Prisoner Court Transports
events.description: Multiple inmates from the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center are scheduled to be transported to various court proceedings in Manhattan, including transfers, hearings, sentencings, and arraignments.

locations: 500 Pearl St. (Manhattan) - Likely the Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse
Courtroom 40 Foley (likely 40 Foley Square, part of the courthouse complex)
keyFacts: This is a routine prisoner transport schedule for the Brooklyn MDC dated July 31, 2019, showing no direct connection to Jeffrey Epstein or his case.
The inmates listed are involved in unrelated federal criminal cases, primarily for offenses like dangerous drugs, fraud, and weapons possession.
One inmate, Andrew Valles, is noted as a 'SEX OFFENDER' with security concerns, but this is unrelated to the Epstein case.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL Limited Official Use,' indicating its sensitive nature within the US Marshals Service.
The schedule details logistical information for the USMS, including court destinations, judges, and specific security cautions for each inmate.
